            class User < ApplicationRecord
          
      2. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    2. 
            

            
              
            

              # Include default devise modules. Others available are:
          
      3. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    3. 
            

            
              
            

              # :confirmable, :lockable, :timeoutable, :trackable and :omniauthable
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            

            
              
            

              devise :database_authenticatable, :registerable,
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            

            
              
            

                     :recoverable, :rememberable, :validatable,
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            

            
              
            

                     :jwt_authenticatable, jwt_revocation_strategy: JwtDenylist
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            

            
              
            

              # Generate JTI on create and set default role
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            

            
              
            

              before_create :generate_jti, :set_default_role
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            

            
              
            

              # Validations
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            

            
              
            

              validates :timezone, presence: true
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            

            
              
            

              validates :role, presence: true, inclusion: { in: %w[client coach] }
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            

            
              
            

              validates :latitude, numericality: { greater_than_or_equal_to: -90, less_than_or_equal_to: 90 }, allow_nil: true
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            

            
              
            

              validates :longitude, numericality: { greater_than_or_equal_to: -180, less_than_or_equal_to: 180 }, allow_nil: true
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            

            
              
            

              validate :valid_timezone
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            

            
              
            

              # JWT token revocation
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            

            
              
            

              def jwt_payload
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            

            
              
            

                { "jti" => jti }
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            

            
              
            

              # Associations
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            

            
              
            

              has_many :owned_lists, class_name: "List", foreign_key: "user_id", dependent: :destroy
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            

            
              
            

              has_many :memberships, dependent: :destroy
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            

            
              
            

              has_many :lists, through: :memberships, source: :list
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            

            
              
            

              has_many :list_shares, dependent: :destroy
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            

            
              
            

              has_many :shared_lists, through: :list_shares, source: :list
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            

            
              
            

              has_many :devices, dependent: :destroy
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            

            
              
            

              # NEW: Coaching associations
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            

            
              
            

              has_many :coaching_relationships_as_coach, class_name: "CoachingRelationship", foreign_key: "coach_id", dependent: :destroy
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            

            
              
            

              has_many :coaching_relationships_as_client, class_name: "CoachingRelationship", foreign_key: "client_id", dependent: :destroy
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            

            
              
            

              has_many :clients, through: :coaching_relationships_as_coach, source: :client
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            

            
              
            

              has_many :coaches, through: :coaching_relationships_as_client, source: :coach
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            

            
              
            

              has_many :created_tasks, class_name: "Task", foreign_key: "creator_id", dependent: :destroy
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            

            
              
            

              has_many :reviewed_tasks, class_name: "Task", foreign_key: "missed_reason_reviewed_by_id", dependent: :nullify
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            

            
              
            

              has_many :saved_locations, dependent: :destroy
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            

            
              
            

              has_many :user_locations, dependent: :destroy
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            

            
              
            

              has_many :notification_logs, dependent: :destroy
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            

            
              
            

              # NEW: Coaching-related methods
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            

            
              
            

              # Check if user is a coach
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            

            
              
            

              def coach?
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            

            
              
            

                role == "coach"
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            

            
              
            

              # Check if user is a client
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            

            
              
            

              def client?
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            

            
              
            

                role == "client"
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            

            
              
            

              # Get all coaching relationships
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            

            
              
            

              def all_coaching_relationships
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            

            
              
            

                coaching_relationships_as_coach.or(coaching_relationships_as_client)
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            

            
              
            

              # Get active coaching relationships
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            

            
              
            

              def active_coaching_relationships
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            

            
              
            

                all_coaching_relationships.active
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            

            
              
            

              # Get all clients (if user is a coach)
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            

            
              
            

              def all_clients
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            

            
              
            

                clients.distinct
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            

            
              
            

              # Get all coaches (if user is a client)
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            

            
              
            

              def all_coaches
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            

            
              
            

                coaches.distinct
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            

            
              
            

              # Check if user has coaching relationship with another user
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            

            
              
            

              def coaching_relationship_with?(other_user)
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            

            
              
            

                all_coaching_relationships.exists?(coach: [ self, other_user ], client: [ self, other_user ])
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            

            
              
            

              # Get coaching relationship with another user
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            

            
              
            

              def coaching_relationship_with(other_user)
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            

            
              
            

                all_coaching_relationships.find_by(
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            

            
              
            

                  coach: [ self, other_user ],
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            

            
              
            

                  client: [ self, other_user ]
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            

            
              
            

                )
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            

            
              
            

              # Get active coaching relationship with a specific coach
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            

            
              
            

              def relationship_with_coach(coach)
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            

            
              
            

                coaching_relationships_as_client.find_by(coach: coach, status: "active")
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            

            
              
            

              # Get active coaching relationship with a specific client
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            

            
              
            

              def relationship_with_client(client)
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            

            
              
            

                coaching_relationships_as_coach.find_by(client: client, status: "active")
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            

            
              
            

              # Get recent location
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            

            
              
            

              def current_location
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            

            
              
            

                user_locations.recent.first
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            

            
              
            

              # Get location history for a time period
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            

            
              
            

              def location_history(start_time, end_time)
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            

            
              
            

                user_locations.within_timeframe(start_time, end_time).recent
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            

            
              
            

              # Check if user is at a specific location
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            

            
              
            

              def at_location?(latitude, longitude, radius = 100)
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            

            
              
            

                return false unless current_location
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            

            
              
            

                current_location.distance_to(latitude, longitude) <= radius
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            

            
              
            

              # Get tasks requiring explanation
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            

            
              
            

              def tasks_requiring_explanation
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            

            
              
            

                all_lists = owned_lists + lists
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            

            
              
            

                Task.joins(:list)
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            

            
              
            

                    .where(list: all_lists)
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            

            
              
            

                    .where(requires_explanation_if_missed: true)
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            

            
              
            

                    .where(status: :pending)
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            

            
              
            

                    .where("due_at < ?", Time.current)
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            

            
              
            

              # Get overdue tasks
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            

            
              
            

              def overdue_tasks
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            

            
              
            

                all_lists = owned_lists + lists
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            

            
              
            

                Task.joins(:list)
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            

            
              
            

                    .where(list: all_lists)
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            

            
              
            

                    .where(status: :pending)
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            

            
              
            

                    .where("due_at < ?", Time.current)
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            

            
              
            

              # Get lists shared with this coach
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            

            
              
            

              def shared_lists
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            

            
              
            

                List.joins(:memberships)
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            

            
              
            

                    .where(memberships: { user: self })
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            

            
              
            

                    .where.not(memberships: { coaching_relationship_id: nil })
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            

            
              
            

              # Get lists owned by this user that are shared with coaches
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            

            
              
            

              def lists_shared_with_coaches
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            

            
              
            

                owned_lists.joins(:memberships)
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            

            
              
            

                           .where.not(memberships: { coaching_relationship_id: nil })
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            

            
              
            

                           .distinct
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            

            
              
            

              # Get devices for push notifications
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            

            
              
            

              def push_devices
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            

            
              
            

                devices.where.not(apns_token: nil)
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            

            
              
            

              # Get iOS devices
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            

            
              
            

              def ios_devices
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            

            
              
            

                devices.ios
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            

            
              
            

              # Get Android devices
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            

            
              
            

              def android_devices
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            

            
              
            

                devices.android
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            

            
              
            

              # Check if user has any registered devices
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            

            
              
            

              def has_devices?
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            

            
              
            

                devices.exists?
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            

            
              
            

              # Get device count
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            

            
              
            

              def device_count
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            

            
              
            

                devices.count
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            

            
              
            

              # Get unread notifications count
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            

            
              
            

              def unread_notifications_count
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            

            
              
            

                notification_logs.where("metadata->>'read' IS NULL OR metadata->>'read' = 'false'").count
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            

            
              
            

              # Get recent notifications
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            

            
              
            

              def recent_notifications(limit = 10)
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            

            
              
            

                notification_logs.recent.limit(limit)
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            

            
              
            

              # Get notifications by type
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            

            
              
            

              def notifications_by_type(type)
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            

            
              
            

                notification_logs.by_type(type)
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            

            
              
            

              # Mark all notifications as read
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            

            
              
            

              def mark_all_notifications_read!
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            

            
              
            

                notification_logs.update_all(
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            

            
              
            

                  metadata: notification_logs.pluck(:metadata).map do |meta|
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            

            
              
            

                    parsed = JSON.parse(meta) rescue {}
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            

            
              
            

                    parsed.merge("read" => true).to_json
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            

            
              
            

                  end
          
      194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    194. 
            

            
              
            

                )
          
      195. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    195. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      196. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    196. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      197. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    197. 
            

            
              
            

              # Get notification statistics
          
      198. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    198. 
            

            
              
            

              def notification_stats
          
      199. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    199. 
            

            
              
            

                {
          
      200. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    200. 
            

            
              
            

                  total: notification_logs.count,
          
      201.

      202.

              # Update user's current location

              def update_location!(latitude, longitude, accuracy = nil)
          
      210. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    210. 
            

            
              
            

                user_locations.create!(

                  recorded_at: Time.current

              # Get location history for a specific time period
          
      219.

              def location_history(start_time = 1.week.ago, end_time = Time.current)
          
      220. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    220. 
            

            
              
            

                user_locations.where(recorded_at: start_time..end_time).order(:recorded_at)

              end
          
      222.

              # Check if user is at a specific saved location
          
      224.

              def at_location?(saved_location, current_latitude = nil, current_longitude = nil)
          
      225. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    225. 
            

            
              
            

                return false unless current_latitude && current_longitude
          
      226. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    226. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      227. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    227. 
            

            
              
            

                # Use current location if not provided
          
      228. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    228. 
            

            
              
            

                current_lat = current_latitude || current_location&.latitude
          
      229. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    229. 
            

            
              
            

                current_lng = current_longitude || current_location&.longitude
          
      230. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    230. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      231. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    231. 
            

            
              
            

                return false unless current_lat && current_lng
          
      232. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    232. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      233. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    233. 
            

            
              
            

                # Calculate distance using Haversine formula
          
      234. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    234. 
            

            
              
            

                distance = calculate_distance(
          
      235. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    235. 
            

            
              
            

                  current_lat, current_lng,

                  saved_location.latitude, saved_location.longitude
          
      237.

                )

    239. 
            

            
              
            

                distance <= saved_location.radius_meters
          
      240. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    240. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      241.

              # Missing methods that tests expect

              def latitude

              # Update current location and track in history
          
      252. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    252. 
            

            
              
            

              def update_current_location(latitude, longitude)
          
      253. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    253. 
            

            
              
            

                # Validate coordinates
          
      254. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    254. 
            

            
              
            

                raise ArgumentError, "Invalid latitude: #{latitude}" if latitude < -90 || latitude > 90
          
      255. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    255. 
            

            
              
            

                raise ArgumentError, "Invalid longitude: #{longitude}" if longitude < -180 || longitude > 180
          
      256. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    256. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      257. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    257. 
            

            
              
            

                # Update current location attributes
          
      258.

                self.current_latitude = latitude
          
      259. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    259. 
            

            
              
            

                self.current_longitude = longitude
          
      260. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    260. 
            

            
              
            

                save!
          
      261. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    261. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      262. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    262. 
            

            
              
            

                # Track in location history
          
      263. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    263. 
            

            
              
            

                update_location!(latitude, longitude)
          
      264. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    264. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      265. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    265. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      266. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    266. 
            

            
              
            

              # Calculate distance to a saved location
          
      267. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    267. 
            

            
              
            

              def distance_to_saved_location(saved_location)
          
      268. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    268. 
            

            
              
            

                return nil unless current_location && saved_location
          
      269. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    269. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      270. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    270. 
            

            
              
            

                current_location.distance_to(saved_location.latitude, saved_location.longitude)
          
      271. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    271. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      272. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    272. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      273. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    273. 
            

            
              
            

              # Check if user is at a saved location
          
      274. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    274. 
            

            
              
            

              def at_saved_location?(saved_location)
          
      275. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    275. 
            

            
              
            

                return false unless current_location && saved_location
          
      276. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    276. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      277. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    277. 
            

            
              
            

                distance = distance_to_saved_location(saved_location)
          
      278. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    278. 
            

            
              
            

                distance && distance <= saved_location.radius_meters
          
      279. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    279. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      280. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    280. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      281. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    281. 
            

            
              
            

              private
          
      282. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    282. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      283. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    283. 
            

            
              
            

              def valid_timezone
          
      284. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    284. 
            

            
              
            

                return if timezone.blank?
          
      285. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    285. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      286. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    286. 
            

            
              
            

                begin
          
      287. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    287. 
            

            
              
            

                  Time.zone = timezone
          
      288. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    288. 
            

            
              
            

                  # If we can set the timezone, it's valid
          
      289. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    289. 
            

            
              
            

                  Time.zone
          
      290. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    290. 
            

            
              
            

                rescue ArgumentError
          
      291. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    291. 
            

            
              
            

                  errors.add(:timezone, "is not a valid timezone")
          
      292. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    292. 
            

            
              
            

                end
          
      293. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    293. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      294. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    294. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      295. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    295. 
            

            
              
            

              # Calculate distance between two points using Haversine formula
          
      296. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    296. 
            

            
              
            

              def calculate_distance(lat1, lon1, lat2, lon2)
          
      297. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    297. 
            

            
              
            

                # Earth's radius in meters
          
      298. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    298. 
            

            
              
            

                earth_radius = 6_371_000
          
      299. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    299. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      300. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    300. 
            

            
              
            

                # Convert degrees to radians
          
      301. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    301. 
            

            
              
            

                lat1_rad = lat1 * Math::PI / 180
          
      302. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    302. 
            

            
              
            

                lat2_rad = lat2 * Math::PI / 180
          
      303. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    303. 
            

            
              
            

                delta_lat = (lat2 - lat1) * Math::PI / 180
          
      304. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    304. 
            

            
              
            

                delta_lon = (lon2 - lon1) * Math::PI / 180
          
      305. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    305. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      306. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    306. 
            

            
              
            

                # Haversine formula
          
      307. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    307. 
            

            
              
            

                a = Math.sin(delta_lat / 2) ** 2 +
          
      308. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    308. 
            

            
              
            

                    Math.cos(lat1_rad) * Math.cos(lat2_rad) *
          
      309. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    309. 
            

            
              
            

                    Math.sin(delta_lon / 2) ** 2
          
      310. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    310. 
            

            
              
            

                c = 2 * Math.atan2(Math.sqrt(a), Math.sqrt(1 - a))
          
      311. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    311. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      312. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    312. 
            

            
              
            

                earth_radius * c
          
      313. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    313. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      314. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    314. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      315. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    315. 
            

            
              
            

              def set_default_role
          
      316. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    316. 
            

            
              
            

                self.role = "client" if role.blank?
          
      317. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    317. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      318. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    318. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      319. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    319. 
            

            
              
            

              def generate_jti
          
      320. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    320. 
            

            
              
            

                self.jti = SecureRandom.uuid
          
      321. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    321. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      322. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    322. 
            

            
              
            

            end
          
      323.

    14 total branches, 0 branches covered and 14 branches missed. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1. 
            
              1
            

            
              
            

            class UserLocation < ApplicationRecord
          
      2. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    2. 
            

            
              
            

              # ----- Constants -----
          
      3. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    3. 
            
              1
            

            
              
            

              SOURCES = %w[gps network passive].freeze
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            
              1
            

            
              
            

              ACCURACY_THRESHOLDS = { high: 10, medium: 50, low: 100 }.freeze
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            
              1
            

            
              
            

              RECENT_WINDOW = 1.hour + 1.minute

    6.

              # ----- Soft delete -----

    11. 
            
              1
            

            
              
            

              default_scope { where(deleted_at: nil) }

              scope :with_deleted, -> { unscope(where: :deleted_at) }

              def soft_delete! = update!(deleted_at: Time.current)

              def restore!     = update!(deleted_at: nil)

    16. 
            
              1
            

            
              
            

              def deleted?     = deleted_at.present?

    17. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      18.

              # ----- Validations -----

              validates :latitude,  presence: true,

                                    numericality: { greater_than_or_equal_to: -90,  less_than_or_equal_to: 90 }

              validates :longitude, presence: true,

              validates :accuracy,

                        allow_nil: true

      31.

                        allow_nil: true

              # ----- Callbacks -----

              # ----- Scopes -----

                  then: 0
                
              
                
                  else: 0
                
              
            

              scope :for_user,  ->(u) { where(user_id: u.is_a?(User) ? u.id : u) }
          
      38.

              scope :accurate,  -> { where("accuracy IS NOT NULL AND accuracy <= ?", ACCURACY_THRESHOLDS[:medium]) }
          
      40.

              1
            

            
              
            

              scope :by_source, ->(s) { where(source: s) }
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            

            
              
            

              # (keep your PostGIS scope if you want; the spec doesn't use it)
          
      43.

              1
            

            
              
            

              scope :nearby, ->(lat, lng, radius = 1000) {

    44. 
            

            
              
            

                where("ST_DWithin(ST_Point(longitude, latitude), ST_Point(?, ?), ?)", lng, lat, radius)

              # ----- Methods the spec expects -----

              1
            

            
              
            

              def coordinates = [ latitude, longitude ]
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            

            
              
            

              # distance to another UserLocation
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
              1
            

            
              
            

              def distance_to(other)
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            

            
              
                
                  then: 0
                
              
                
                  else: 0
                
              
            

                return 0 if other.nil?
          
      53.

                distance_to_coordinates(other.latitude, other.longitude)

              end
          
      55.

      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            

            
              
            

              # distance to coordinates (meters) – Haversine
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
              1
            

            
              
            

              def distance_to_coordinates(lat, lng)
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            

            
              
                
                  then: 0
                
              
                
                  else: 0
                
              
            

                return 0 if lat == latitude && lng == longitude
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            

            
              
            

                rad = Math::PI / 180.0
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            

            
              
            

                r_km = 6371.0
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            

            
              
            

                dlat = (lat - latitude) * rad
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            

            
              
            

                dlng = (lng - longitude) * rad
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            

            
              
            

                lat1 = latitude * rad
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            

            
              
            

                lat2 = lat * rad
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            

            
              
            

                a = Math.sin(dlat / 2)**2 +
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            

            
              
            

                    Math.cos(lat1) * Math.cos(lat2) * Math.sin(dlng / 2)**2
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            

            
              
            

                c = 2 * Math.atan2(Math.sqrt(a), Math.sqrt(1 - a))
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            

            
              
            

                (r_km * c * 1000).round
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      73.

    74. 
            
              1
            

            
              
            

              def accurate? = accuracy.present? && accuracy <= ACCURACY_THRESHOLDS[:medium]

            class MembershipPolicy < ApplicationPolicy

              def destroy?
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            

            
              
            

                # Can remove members if user can invite to the list
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            

            
              
            

                # OR if the membership belongs to the current user (self-removal)

    25. 
            

            
              
            

                record.list.can_invite?(user) || record.user == user

              class Scope < ApplicationPolicy::Scope

                def resolve

      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            

            
              
            

              def as_json
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            

            
              
            

                {
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            

            
              
            

                  id: location.id,
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            

            
              
            

                  name: location.name,
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            

            
              
            

                  latitude: location.latitude.to_f,
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            

            
              
            

                  longitude: location.longitude.to_f,
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            

            
              
            

                  radius_meters: location.radius_meters,
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            

            
              
            

                  address: location.address,
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            

            
              
            

                  created_at: location.created_at.iso8601,
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            

            
              
            

                  updated_at: location.updated_at.iso8601
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            

            
              
            

                }
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            

            
              
            

            end
          
      21.

            # app/serializers/task_serializer.rb

            class TaskSerializer
          
      3. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    3. 
            

            
              
            

              attr_reader :task, :current_user, :options

      5.

              def initialize(task, current_user:, **options)
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            

            
              
            

                @task = task
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            

            
              
            

                @current_user = current_user
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            

            
              
            

                @options = options
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            

            
              
            

              end
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            

            
              
            

              def as_json
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            

            
              
            

                {
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            

            
              
            

                  id: task.id,
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            

            
              
            

                  list_id: task.list_id,
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            

            
              
            

                  title: task.title,
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            

            
              
            

                  note: task.note,
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            

            
              
            

                  description: task.note,
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            

            
              
            

                  due_at: task.due_at&.iso8601,
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            

            
              
            

                  completed_at: completed_at_value,
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            

            
              
            

                  priority: derive_priority,
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            

            
              
            

                  can_be_snoozed: !task.strict_mode,
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            

            
              
            

                  notification_interval_minutes: task.notification_interval_minutes || 10,
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            

            
              
            

                  requires_explanation_if_missed: task.requires_explanation_if_missed || false,
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            

            
              
            

            
          
      25.

                  notify_on_departure: task.notify_on_departure || false,

    75. 
            

            
              
            

                  # Timestamps
          
      76.
